intro: Leptinella bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá leaptinella, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Leptinella bogotensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas.
